headline: Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas
description: These black bean quesadillas are filled with a slightly sweet and spicy mix of corn, salsa, and Monterey Jack cheese for an easy vegetarian meal.

video.description: This Mexican favorite can be made easily for a quick weeknight dinner.
video.name: Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas

name: Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas
recipeIngredient: 1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in beans and corn, then add salsa, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes; mix well. Cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.

Melt about 1 1/2 teaspoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the Monterey Jack cheese, then top with 1/4 of the bean mixture. Place another tortilla on top; cook until the bottom is golden, then carefully flip and cook until the other side is golden. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.

review.reviewBody: These are excellent. I love the sweetness of the corn and brown sugar, the mildness and creaminess of the black beans and cheese. The red pepper and my spicy home made salsa made my tastebuds dance! I served these on a bed of lettuce with sour cream and guacamole. What a delicious meal!

It is very balanced, the only thing I did different was use one tortilla and just folded it over. It makes it a smaller portion but flipping sometimes can get messy. Great nibbles for the football game. Hubby loves them
Followed recipe as is. Threw in a pinch of cumin, a pinch of garlic and a tablespoon of cilantro after it cooked. Hubby and daughter asked for seconds! Thanks for delicious recipe.

As written, this is a 3-star recipe - it needed more flavor, but definitely not the sweetness called for in the brown sugar, so I left it out. I added more salsa and sprinkled in some taco seasoning to taste. I also baked a couple of chicken breasts, coated in taco seasoning and then diced them up and added them to the filling (but it would have been just as great without the chicken). After those additions, this is now a 5-star recipe with my family.

Turns out my better half doesn't like corn mixed in with other foods so I subbed in a red pepper instead. Great combination of sweet and spicy. Wasn't sure if I should add the brown sugar or not, but it was a good addition.
So happy I came across this recipe! Quick, easy and delicious. Only thing I added to the mixture was some spinach I needed to use up. Great meatless meal!
Perfect recipe as is! I really love salsa so sometimes I add a little extra :)

This was delicious... but I made modifications. I skipped the brown sugar (trying to eliminate sugar), added an extra 1/4 cup of salsa (because it's my homemade salsa and it's delicious), added cumin, adobo and chili powder to taste, and mozzarella cheese (because it's all I had). It was awesome.
This is a great recipe.......easy to make and good to eat. I make it often because of these 2 things.
Really good. My son is a vegetarian and I made this for him but enjoyed it myself! I will definitely make again.
Easy, cheap, and vegetarian... you can’t beat it! Cheese before and after the beans makes it stick together better.

As it is, we didn’t love this recipe. The second time I made it we omitted the sugar and added a Small can of diced chilies and it was much better. I also used more onion and added some diced pepper. The family loved it.
Love it!!! We added chicken so I doubled the sauce ingredients and it was a game changer! This will always be how I make them going forward!
Everyone loved. I will bake them in the oven next time. Instead of butter lightly brush with olive oil and back for 15-20 minutes 325 oven flipping half way.
It was good! Liked it! Easy to make!
So good. So much you can do with this recipe. Good totally as is or whatever you want to add in.
This is an easy recipe and they are simply delicious. I don't even cook so I tried a simple recipe, followed it to a t and it's so yummy. Next time I may add just a little bit more salsa to the mix.
Absolutely fantastic! I added shredded rotisserie chicken to the skillet and then baked them at 375* on convection mode for 8-10 minutes. Everyone agreed they were the best quesadillas to-date!
Love it! I like it spicy so I used a tablespoon of crushed red pepper. Also added some lime juice.
These were very good! I cut the tortillas in half in the skillet to make it easier to flip them over.
Made it just as directed and it was very good. Perfect for a quick meal and easily customizable if that’s what you are into.
I doubled the salsa and added a can of green chilies. We really enjoyed it.
We eliminated the cilantro and served them with Sour cream, salsa, Sriracha and shredded red leaf lettuce. EXCELLENT!! This recipe is going to be a repeated dinner in our house for years to come!
Excellent! Easy and flavorful. I too, folded them in half and baked them in the oven. Will definitely make them again.
It wonderful. Made it and love it.
Quick, easy and delicious!
Delicious!

I cannot tell you how many times I've made this over the years. Not sure why I've never written a review but I suppose the spirit moved me today.

I made this last night for dinner and my 21-year-old said, "Great, you're making my favorite meal when I'm making dinner with my friends." Grumble, grumble.

The 19-year-old breezily replied, "You can always have the leftovers!"

I don't know when I first retrieved this recipe from this site but I know it was probably a very long time ago. 

Because this recipe is perfect the way it is written, I haven't changed a thing.

The only tip I would impart is that we cook the quesadillas on a griddle--it's just easier.

Enjoy!
Next time add some fresh cilantro to the bean mix.

Great recipe! I left out the chili pepper flakes and used mild salsa to avoid spice and it turned out great! I used the portions for 2 servings and it was just the right amount of filling for 1 full sized quesadilla.
Gave this C minus. Bland. Didnt like the corn & bean mix. wouldnt make it agsin.
This was delicious! I omitted the brown sugar

The concept is good, but we found these to be very boring, so would not recommend recipe as is. They came out better after I made several changes, but I think recipes should be rated as is, have a personal issue with people who give a recipe 4 or 5 stars, then when you read the review, they say recipe wasn't good as written, but was 5 stars with their many changes. If interested, I doubled the onion, red pepper flakes, and salsa. Also added 1 teaspoon cumin and 2 teaspoons cilantro flakes.
This is the best quesadilla I’ve had in a long time! I added a little salt, sour cream, and avocado. Full of flavor and quick to make.
Great recipe, my vegetarian husband loved it.

Fantasitic Recipe, I have made it many times over. A cast Iron skillet is a must for these quesadillas. I add hot sauce to the filling because I like it spicy, but without it the flavor is pleasing, but mild.

Ok - the idea here is good. This needs some serious tweaking. (I've been a veg for 50 years and made a LOT of stuff.) In order for this to hold together on a tortilla or two, one will need more cheese. I did these in the oven = best option. Spices needed: cumin, cayenne/or 'zip' of your choice. I didn't find it too sweet and at least for us, the red pepper flake taste was too diluted. Worth another go-round, though.
Followed recipe as written. I enjoyed them and will be part of my rotation menu, the one that is “When I don’t feel like cooking”.
It was ok. Tasty, but we are big meat eaters, so shredded chicken would have made a big difference for us.
I know it's called black bean and corn quesadillas but I left out the corn and it tasted great!
These are amazing!!! I added some jalapeños and red peppers as well! Would definitely make this again was a hit. Served it with guacamole and sour cream on the side. Yum!

These were great! I skipped the salsa and brown sugar and instead sprinkled chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, oregano, garlic salt and pepper.

Also, I only had Mexican four cheese, so I used that. 

Put salsa on the side and a little sour cream, and I gotta say...these were AMAZING!!

I used half can of beans and corn. 3 Tbs of chopped onion and the full amount of mild tomato salsa and tomotilla salsa and 1 Tbsp of brown sugar. No hot pepper because I don't like it hot. It was just the right amount of spice for me and was delicious! SO EASY! and used items I already had. I used corn tortillas.

this was so good we had them for lunch today and wanted to thank you for the recipe 
god bless you
I used the filling to make burritos that I froze. Really excellent!
We love this! I add rotisserie chicken in the tortilla and just use a dash of red pepper flakes. I don't make it in the oven, just on the cooktop. My husband loves this mean and it is so easy
It was so good and simple. It tastes way better if you have chicken so make sure you add that too!
I did not make any changes and pan to make this as my go to for quesadillas with such great flavor!
Not wild about the frying - loved the corn and bean mixture and will be doing that again. I think I will try baking them next time.

disappointing to say the least. bland and dry. while trying to cook and eat everything would fall out. thankfully i found a way to make it work. following the advice of others i decided to put the bean and corn mixture on only one tortilla (grating some cheese on top) and baked in the oven. once out i put more salsa on top and ate it like a pizza. less dry, less bland and less messy.

I made this yesterday for my boyfriend for lunch. It was quick (for a lunch hour meal), easy and super delicious. I followed the recipe as is and then finished them in the oven (low temp) to add extra crispness. Overall consensus from a happy Boyfriend: “5 out of 5.” Will definitely be having these again, maybe next time with added chicken!!
I used canned Bush's Black Bean Fiesta and Cheddar cheese for my filling.
Trying to ease into a vegetarian diet, and this was my first dish! Super easy, and my mom loved it too! Dipped in guac to make it extra good!
This was super quick & easy. We didn’t change a thing. My bf and I loved it! We will definitely be making this one again.

So yummy and easy to make. Makes enough for four servings. Too much for one person. 
Found this on the internet @ https://www.unlockfood.ca/en/Articles/Budget/All-About-Beans.aspx
Dried beans that have been cooked can be kept covered in the fridge for 5-7 days or frozen for up to 6 months. Label with a date and store beans in an airtight container made for freezing food or wrapped tightly in heavy foil.
Very good! We're a small family, so I opted to use part of a bag of frozen C&W Southwest Blend (peppers, black beans, corn, etc.) and it worked out fine. Thanks for sharing your yummy recipe!

Very easy & quite quick to put together when you prepare the filling ahead. My reason for the missing star is the addition of brown sugar in the recipe - waay too much "sweet" for our palette in combination with the corn, so I was glad I went with my instinct & left it out. Our adult son doesn't like sour cream or guacamole, so we had extra salsa with a good squeeze of lime juice & a grind of habanero pink salt - the tang perked everything up! We are vegetarians too, so I love to see plant based recipes coming in from so many creative chefs. Thank you!
This was great! The only thing I will change next time is add less sugar. Thought it was a little too sweet for my kiddos. But other than that will be making again!
Paired with sour cream and extra salsa for a quick and easy meal. Very good vegetarian recipe. Thanks!
Very good dinner. Love the brown sugar too. A very filling and satisfying quesadilla. I will save it and make it again and again.
also, I did them on my electric griddle and was able to do 4 at a time
Use frozen corn and do not add brown sugar.
I didn't have black beans so I substituted them for pineapple and it was amazing!
I skipped the sugar and used a tomato tortilla instead. Since it is just me tonight I only used a small portion of ingredients to make one. Very filling and quite tasty. Thanks!

These are fantastic. I honestly hate quesadillas, I think they aren't filling, I've eaten so many plain cheese ones in my life that just the thought of eating them turns me off, but these have changed my mind. I love the sweet savory flavor of them, the flavors work so incredibly well together. Even my husband who hated anything black bean after I made him eat a bunch of black bean burgers, loved these quesadillas. The beans made them especially filling.
Really good! Added a little hot sauce too and it came out great!
Great taste. I take these to party’s as my appetizer on a baking tray sheet and heat in the oven as suggested in another review and then broil for a minute to get the whole thing crisp. 5 Star.
Pretty simple, pretty great!

This is my new fave quesadilla recipe! I love it. I added zucchini, red pepper, cilantro, cumin, garlic and onion powder, and salt. I used soft taco size tortillas and folded them in half instead of using two, and frozen corn, shredded mexican cheese, omitted the pepper flakes. Then I cooked them on my panini grill. They weren't messy for me. I will be making these more often!

After reading other reviews and not having all ingredients on hand, I decided to try this anyway--I'm glad I did. I started out with a pound of ground chicken, added chopped onion and banana peppers. Then added refried black beans w/green chilies & jalapenos, and a can of well-rinsed creamed corn. I used some taco seasoning, left out the brown sugar, and added cumin. I fixed these in the oven at 450 for about 5 minutes till turning golden. We love them. Will make again. Just throw things together that you like--it just might work.
These were awesome! Quick and easy recipe for a busy work night.

Fabulous meal! I added Kirkland brand canned chicken and used wheat tortillas for adults and white tortillas for kids. Wheat tortillas stuck a little more to the pan than white tortillas. I used Pam spray instead of butter and they toasted nicely but the wheat still still stuck to pan.
We love it. I also baked them in the oven at 350 its a great recipe.
These were really good! Quick and easy to make also.

I love this recipe because it is easy and versatile! I sauteed diced red peppers and diced jalapenos with the onion in lieu of the salsa because I didn't have any on hand. I also used sharp cheddar. Don't be afraid to sub. It was delish! My husband said he would be a vegetarian for the night and to be sure to add this dish to our weekly menu.

So simple and tasty. Next time I’ll cut back on the brown sugar as the corn lends enough sweetness to the recipe. 
Served with the usual suspects ie salsa, sour cream etc and you’ve got a good dinner on a warm evening. Enjoy
Loved this recipe! Even picky husband liked it!!!

I skip the onion and sugar. Add minced garlic and used rotel rather than salsa, allowing the liquid to reduce in the heated black beans and corn. Adding chopped spinach or other veggies turns out well, also.
Yummy!! Easy to make and easy to adjust. Made exactly as written except used frozen corn. You can add any number of other flavors or seasoning. Keeper.

This is a go-to vegetarian meal for us now. As mentioned on my other reviews, it's been difficult to find vegetarian meals that I can prepare (that taste good!) That don't take a lot of time or tofu (I still can't cook it properly). This was quick to cook up. As always, I eyeball the seasonings, but I also cooked the salsa in with the black beans and corn. It really helped meld the flavors and make it pop.

Every family member volunteered their approval so this is a keeper. I used a parchment on a half-sheet, olive oiled the down-side of the tortilla in one layer. Then, cheese followed by bean/corn mixture. Then more cheese. Oiled the top-side of tortillas as final layer. Baked in the oven for 15 minutes. I think the brown sugar was key in balancing the salsa, as mentioned in the video.
Really easy, I just added at least twice as much salsa if not more to give it a little bit more color.
These are excellent! My family loves this recipe.

This was a fantastic quesadilla recipe! Thank you! A few tips I might add are as follows: 1. Smaller tortillas, such as fajita size, are much easier to work with, as they can be flipped with minimal fuss or fallout. The smaller size tortillas also allow for more individual servings; they are perfect for younger kids; easy to hold and eat, either cut into triangles or left whole, and there is not a lot of waste. I used soft taco sized tortillas initially, and they were fine, but for the subsequent quesadillas, the smaller ones worked better. 2. If you grate your own cheese, it seems to melt better than the pre-shredded cheese. I also found that scattering a bit more cheese on top of the filling will glue the top and bottom tortillas together. I didn’t change anything else, and this recipe was terrific! I used organic canned black beans; they are a bit smaller than non-organic, and canned corn with no salt added. I also used organic jarred salsa, and I think those ingredients made a difference in taste. Just very clean and fresh tasting. Doing without the casein in pre-grated packaged cheese also made a difference, I believe. I am going to try this sometime with diced green chile, white beans, Colby cheese and chopped tomatoes. Thank you again!
I really enjoyed this recipe. It was tasty and easy to make. I added chicken to this and enjoyes the beans and corn. I will make this again.
Again my whole family loves it, and they say it’s better than regular cheese or meat ones.
Made them for myself, husband ended up eating more than me. Big hit here!
my kids loved it. i didnt have salsa so i used cherry tomatoes . i also added some store broght burrito spice mix. its a super hit with my picky eater.
We used frozen corn instead of canned and really enjoyed this recipe. Next time we are going to leave out the sugar entirely as the corn is sweet enough on its own.

I added the juice of a lime, cilantro and some jalapeno. The final result was very messy. I think it was the combination of the salsa addition and the Monterey jack which is a softer cheese when it's melted. I'll make this again but probably with cheddar because I think it will hold together better
Great & easy recipe; very tasty, & a nice meatless meal alternative.
My picky eater just asked to save her a few for lunch tomorrow, score! I left out the onion but otherwise followed the recipe. Super quick and tasty!
Love it
These were good, but I would use a spicy or regular salsa next time. I used a mango peach salsa and it lacked the flavor I expected. Great to pack for lunch the next day and reheat.

My family all love these quesadillas. Picky husband eats them, the kid who hates greasy quesadillas loves them, and they cook up so fast I can make them when I’ve had enough of life. Thanks for the great recipe!
Delicious! However, I just made cheese quesadillas and had the bean and corn mixture as a dip because I was afraid it would make quesadillas too messy.
I've tried a lot of corn and black dishes that were always a bit bland but the little bit of sugar really brought out the flavors. I found these very filling and will make again.

I made it exactly as written, I would definitely skip the brown sugar if I had to do it again. Corn is sweet as it is, brown sugar just makes it way too sweet. Overall it's an easy recipe but not worth the time or the clean up. Skip all the cooking, just drain and rinse beans and corn, put some on a big tortilla, add some brushetta or pico-de-gallo (even better if you like it spicy), chopped jalapeno (fresh or pickled), cilantro, green onions and cheese. Fold it in half and toast on a pan or in the oven, flip to toast on both sides until slightly crispy. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

I liked it, although I did not have any of the red flakes. I added some sour cream to the bean and corn mixture. Husband suggested I add ground beef (he likes the taste of ground beef) but I feel it is not necessary since the beans are filling and have protein. Easy to make.
